name: clipboard
description: Perform copy and paste operations on the system clipboard.

name: crashReporter
description: Submit crash reports to a remote server.

name: nativeImage
description: Create tray, dock, and application icons using PNG or JPG files.

instanceMethods.name: toPng
instanceMethods.description: Returns a Buffer that contains the image's PNG encoded data.

instanceMethods.name: toJpeg
instanceMethods.description: Returns a Buffer that contains the image's JPEG encoded data.

instanceMethods.name: toDataURL
instanceMethods.description: Returns the data URL of the image.

instanceMethods.name: getNativeHandle
instanceMethods.description: Returns a Buffer that stores C pointer to underlying native handle of the image. On OS X, a pointer to NSImage instance would be returned. Notice that the returned pointer is a weak pointer to the underlying native image instead of a copy, so you must ensure that the associated nativeImage instance is kept around.

instanceMethods.name: isEmpty
instanceMethods.description: Returns a boolean whether the image is empty.

instanceMethods.name: getSize
instanceMethods.description: Returns the size of the image.

instanceMethods.name: setTemplateImage
instanceMethods.description: Marks the image as template image.

instanceMethods.name: isTemplateImage
instanceMethods.description: Returns a boolean whether the image is a template image.

name: shell
description: Manage files and URLs using their default applications.

name: app
description: Control your application's event lifecycle.

events.name: will-finish-launching
events.description: Emitted when the application has finished basic startup. On Windows and Linux, the will-finish-launching event is the same as the ready event; on OS X, this event represents the applicationWillFinishLaunching notification of NSApplication. You would usually set up listeners for the open-file and open-url events here, and start the crash reporter and auto updater. In most cases, you should just do everything in the ready event handler.

events.name: ready
events.description: Emitted when Electron has finished initialization.

events.name: window-all-closed
events.description: Emitted when all windows have been closed. If you do not subscribe to this event and all windows are closed, the default behavior is to quit the app; however, if you subscribe, you control whether the app quits or not. If the user pressed Cmd + Q, or the developer called app.quit(), Electron will first try to close all the windows and then emit the will-quit event, and in this case the window-all-closed event would not be emitted.

events.name: before-quit
events.description: Emitted before the application starts closing its windows. Calling event.preventDefault() will prevent the default behaviour, which is terminating the application.

events.name: will-quit
events.description: Emitted when all windows have been closed and the application will quit. Calling event.preventDefault() will prevent the default behaviour, which is terminating the application. See the description of the window-all-closed event for the differences between the will-quit and window-all-closed events.

events.name: quit
events.description: Emitted when the application is quitting.

events.name: open-file
events.description: Emitted when the user wants to open a file with the application. The open-file event is usually emitted when the application is already open and the OS wants to reuse the application to open the file. open-file is also emitted when a file is dropped onto the dock and the application is not yet running. Make sure to listen for the open-file event very early in your application startup to handle this case (even before the ready event is emitted). You should call event.preventDefault() if you want to handle this event. On Windows, you have to parse process.argv (in the main process) to get the filepath.

events.name: open-url
events.description: Emitted when the user wants to open a URL with the application. The URL scheme must be registered to be opened by your application. You should call event.preventDefault() if you want to handle this event.

events.name: activate
events.description: Emitted when the application is activated, which usually happens when the user clicks on the application's dock icon.

events.name: continue-activity
events.description: Emitted during Handoff when an activity from a different device wants to be resumed. You should call event.preventDefault() if you want to handle this event. A user activity can be continued only in an app that has the same developer Team ID as the activity's source app and that supports the activity's type. Supported activity types are specified in the app's Info.plist under the NSUserActivityTypes key.

returns.name: type
returns.description: A string identifying the activity. Maps to

returns.name: userInfo
returns.description: Contains app-specific state stored by the activity on

events.name: browser-window-blur
events.description: Emitted when a browserWindow gets blurred.

events.name: browser-window-focus
events.description: Emitted when a browserWindow gets focused.

events.name: browser-window-created
events.description: Emitted when a new browserWindow is created.

events.name: web-contents-created
events.description: Emitted when a new webContents is created.

events.name: certificate-error
events.description: Emitted when failed to verify the certificate for url, to trust the certificate you should prevent the default behavior with event.preventDefault() and call callback(true).

returns.name: error
returns.description: The error code

events.name: select-client-certificate
events.description: Emitted when a client certificate is requested. The url corresponds to the navigation entry requesting the client certificate and callback needs to be called with an entry filtered from the list. Using event.preventDefault() prevents the application from using the first certificate from the store.

events.name: login
events.description: Emitted when webContents wants to do basic auth. The default behavior is to cancel all authentications, to override this you should prevent the default behavior with event.preventDefault() and call callback(username, password) with the credentials.

events.name: gpu-process-crashed
events.description: Emitted when the gpu process crashes.

name: autoUpdater
description: Enable apps to automatically update themselves.

events.name: error
events.description: Emitted when there is an error while updating.

events.name: checking-for-update
events.description: Emitted when checking if an update has started.

events.name: update-available
events.description: Emitted when there is an available update. The update is downloaded automatically.

events.name: update-not-available
events.description: Emitted when there is no available update.

events.name: update-downloaded
events.description: Emitted when an update has been downloaded. On Windows only releaseName is available.

name: BrowserWindow
description: Create and control browser windows.

instanceMethods.name: destroy
instanceMethods.description: Force closing the window, the unload and beforeunload event won't be emitted for the web page, and close event will also not be emitted for this window, but it guarantees the closed event will be emitted.

instanceMethods.name: close
instanceMethods.description: Try to close the window, this has the same effect with user manually clicking the close button of the window. The web page may cancel the close though, see the close event.

instanceMethods.name: focus
instanceMethods.description: Focus on the window.

instanceMethods.name: blur
instanceMethods.description: Remove focus on the window.

instanceMethods.name: isFocused
instanceMethods.description: Returns a boolean, whether the window is focused.

instanceMethods.name: show
instanceMethods.description: Shows and gives focus to the window.

instanceMethods.name: showInactive
instanceMethods.description: Shows the window but doesn't focus on it.

instanceMethods.name: hide
instanceMethods.description: Hides the window.

instanceMethods.name: isVisible
instanceMethods.description: Returns a boolean, whether the window is visible to the user.

instanceMethods.name: maximize
instanceMethods.description: Maximizes the window.

instanceMethods.name: unmaximize
instanceMethods.description: Unmaximizes the window.

instanceMethods.name: isMaximized
instanceMethods.description: Returns a boolean, whether the window is maximized.

instanceMethods.name: minimize
instanceMethods.description: Minimizes the window. On some platforms the minimized window will be shown in the Dock.

instanceMethods.name: restore
instanceMethods.description: Restores the window from minimized state to its previous state.

instanceMethods.name: isMinimized
instanceMethods.description: Returns a boolean, whether the window is minimized.

instanceMethods.name: setFullScreen
instanceMethods.description: Sets whether the window should be in fullscreen mode.

instanceMethods.name: isFullScreen
instanceMethods.description: Returns a boolean, whether the window is in fullscreen mode.

instanceMethods.name: setAspectRatio
instanceMethods.description: This will have a window maintain an aspect ratio. The extra size allows a developer to have space, specified in pixels, not included within the aspect ratio calculations. This API already takes into account the difference between a window's size and its content size. Consider a normal window with an HD video player and associated controls. Perhaps there are 15 pixels of controls on the left edge, 25 pixels of controls on the right edge and 50 pixels of controls below the player. In order to maintain a 16:9 aspect ratio (standard aspect ratio for HD @1920x1080) within the player itself we would call this function with arguments of 16/9 and [ 40, 50 ]. The second argument doesn't care where the extra width and height are within the content view--only that they exist. Just sum any extra width and height areas you have within the overall content view.

instanceMethods.name: setBounds
instanceMethods.description: Resizes and moves the window to width, height, x, y.

instanceMethods.name: getBounds
instanceMethods.description: Returns an object that contains window's width, height, x and y values.

instanceMethods.name: setSize
instanceMethods.description: Resizes the window to width and height.

instanceMethods.name: getSize
instanceMethods.description: Returns an array that contains window's width and height.

instanceMethods.name: setContentSize
instanceMethods.description: Resizes the window's client area (e.g. the web page) to width and height.

instanceMethods.name: getContentSize
instanceMethods.description: Returns an array that contains window's client area's width and height.

instanceMethods.name: setMinimumSize
instanceMethods.description: Sets the minimum size of window to width and height.

instanceMethods.name: getMinimumSize
instanceMethods.description: Returns an array that contains window's minimum width and height.

instanceMethods.name: setMaximumSize
instanceMethods.description: Sets the maximum size of window to width and height.

instanceMethods.name: getMaximumSize
instanceMethods.description: Returns an array that contains window's maximum width and height.

instanceMethods.name: setResizable
instanceMethods.description: Sets whether the window can be manually resized by user.

instanceMethods.name: isResizable
instanceMethods.description: Returns whether the window can be manually resized by user.

instanceMethods.name: setMovable
instanceMethods.description: Sets whether the window can be moved by user. On Linux does nothing.

instanceMethods.name: isMovable
instanceMethods.description: Returns whether the window can be moved by user. On Linux always returns true.

instanceMethods.name: setMinimizable
instanceMethods.description: Sets whether the window can be manually minimized by user. On Linux does nothing.

instanceMethods.name: isMinimizable
instanceMethods.description: Returns whether the window can be manually minimized by user. On Linux always returns true.

instanceMethods.name: setMaximizable
instanceMethods.description: Sets whether the window can be manually maximized by user. On Linux does nothing.

instanceMethods.name: isMaximizable
instanceMethods.description: Returns whether the window can be manually maximized by user. On Linux always returns true.

instanceMethods.name: setFullScreenable
instanceMethods.description: Sets whether the maximize/zoom window button toggles fullscreen mode or maximizes the window.

instanceMethods.name: isFullScreenable
instanceMethods.description: Returns whether the maximize/zoom window button toggles fullscreen mode or maximizes the window.

instanceMethods.name: setClosable
instanceMethods.description: Sets whether the window can be manually closed by user. On Linux does nothing.

instanceMethods.name: isClosable
instanceMethods.description: Returns whether the window can be manually closed by user. On Linux always returns true.

instanceMethods.name: setAlwaysOnTop
instanceMethods.description: Sets whether the window should show always on top of other windows. After setting this, the window is still a normal window, not a toolbox window which can not be focused on.

instanceMethods.name: isAlwaysOnTop
instanceMethods.description: Returns whether the window is always on top of other windows.

instanceMethods.name: center
instanceMethods.description: Moves window to the center of the screen.

instanceMethods.name: setPosition
instanceMethods.description: Moves window to x and y.

instanceMethods.name: getPosition
instanceMethods.description: Returns an array that contains window's current position.

instanceMethods.name: setTitle
instanceMethods.description: Changes the title of native window to title.

instanceMethods.name: getTitle
instanceMethods.description: Returns the title of the native window. Note: The title of web page can be different from the title of the native window.

instanceMethods.name: setSheetOffset
instanceMethods.description: Changes the attachment point for sheets on Mac OS X. By default, sheets are attached just below the window frame, but you may want to display them beneath a HTML-rendered toolbar. For example:

instanceMethods.name: flashFrame
instanceMethods.description: Starts or stops flashing the window to attract user's attention.

instanceMethods.name: setSkipTaskbar
instanceMethods.description: Makes the window not show in the taskbar.

instanceMethods.name: setKiosk
instanceMethods.description: Enters or leaves the kiosk mode.

instanceMethods.name: isKiosk
instanceMethods.description: Returns whether the window is in kiosk mode.

instanceMethods.name: getNativeWindowHandle
instanceMethods.description: Returns the platform-specific handle of the window as Buffer. The native type of the handle is HWND on Windows, NSView* on OS X, and Window (unsigned long) on Linux.

instanceMethods.name: hookWindowMessage
instanceMethods.description: Hooks a windows message. The callback is called when the message is received in the WndProc.

instanceMethods.name: isWindowMessageHooked
instanceMethods.description: Returns true or false depending on whether the message is hooked.

instanceMethods.name: unhookWindowMessage
instanceMethods.description: Unhook the window message.

instanceMethods.name: unhookAllWindowMessages
instanceMethods.description: Unhooks all of the window messages.

instanceMethods.name: setRepresentedFilename
instanceMethods.description: Sets the pathname of the file the window represents, and the icon of the file will show in window's title bar.

instanceMethods.name: getRepresentedFilename
instanceMethods.description: Returns the pathname of the file the window represents.

instanceMethods.name: setDocumentEdited
instanceMethods.description: Specifies whether the windowâ€™s document has been edited, and the icon in title bar will become gray when set to true.

instanceMethods.name: isDocumentEdited
instanceMethods.description: Whether the window's document has been edited.

instanceMethods.name: capturePage
instanceMethods.description: Captures a snapshot of the page within rect. Upon completion callback will be called with callback(image). The image is an instance of NativeImage that stores data of the snapshot. Omitting rect will capture the whole visible page.

instanceMethods.name: loadURL
instanceMethods.description: Same as webContents.loadURL(url[, options]).

instanceMethods.name: reload
instanceMethods.description: Same as webContents.reload.

instanceMethods.name: setMenu
instanceMethods.description: Sets the menu as the window's menu bar, setting it to null will remove the menu bar.

instanceMethods.name: setProgressBar
instanceMethods.description: Sets progress value in progress bar. Valid range is [0, 1.0]. Remove progress bar when progress < 0; Change to indeterminate mode when progress > 1. On Linux platform, only supports Unity desktop environment, you need to specify the *.desktop file name to desktopName field in package.json. By default, it will assume app.getName().desktop.

instanceMethods.name: setOverlayIcon
instanceMethods.description: Sets a 16 x 16 pixel overlay onto the current taskbar icon, usually used to convey some sort of application status or to passively notify the user.

instanceMethods.name: setHasShadow
instanceMethods.description: Sets whether the window should have a shadow. On Windows and Linux does nothing.

instanceMethods.name: hasShadow
instanceMethods.description: Returns whether the window has a shadow. On Windows and Linux always returns true.

instanceMethods.name: setThumbarButtons
instanceMethods.description: Add a thumbnail toolbar with a specified set of buttons to the thumbnail image of a window in a taskbar button layout. Returns a Boolean object indicates whether the thumbnail has been added successfully. The number of buttons in thumbnail toolbar should be no greater than 7 due to the limited room. Once you setup the thumbnail toolbar, the toolbar cannot be removed due to the platform's limitation. But you can call the API with an empty array to clean the buttons. The buttons is an array of Button objects: The flags is an array that can include following Strings:

instanceMethods.name: showDefinitionForSelection
instanceMethods.description: Same as webContents.showDefinitionForSelection().

instanceMethods.name: setIcon
instanceMethods.description: Changes window icon.

instanceMethods.name: setAutoHideMenuBar
instanceMethods.description: Sets whether the window menu bar should hide itself automatically. Once set the menu bar will only show when users press the single Alt key. If the menu bar is already visible, calling setAutoHideMenuBar(true) won't hide it immediately.

instanceMethods.name: isMenuBarAutoHide
instanceMethods.description: Returns whether menu bar automatically hides itself.

instanceMethods.name: setMenuBarVisibility
instanceMethods.description: Sets whether the menu bar should be visible. If the menu bar is auto-hide, users can still bring up the menu bar by pressing the single Alt key.

instanceMethods.name: isMenuBarVisible
instanceMethods.description: Returns whether the menu bar is visible.

instanceMethods.name: setVisibleOnAllWorkspaces
instanceMethods.description: Sets whether the window should be visible on all workspaces. Note: This API does nothing on Windows.

instanceMethods.name: isVisibleOnAllWorkspaces
instanceMethods.description: Returns whether the window is visible on all workspaces. Note: This API always returns false on Windows.

instanceMethods.name: setIgnoreMouseEvents
instanceMethods.description: Makes the window ignore all mouse events. All mouse events happened in this window will be passed to the window below this window, but if this window has focus, it will still receive keyboard events.

instanceMethods.name: setFocusable
instanceMethods.description: Changes whether the window can be focused.

events.name: page-title-updated
events.description: Emitted when the document changed its title, calling event.preventDefault() would prevent the native window's title to change.

events.name: close
events.description: Emitted when the window is going to be closed. It's emitted before the beforeunload and unload event of the DOM. Calling event.preventDefault() will cancel the close. Usually you would want to use the beforeunload handler to decide whether the window should be closed, which will also be called when the window is reloaded. In Electron, returning any value other than undefined would cancel the close. For example:

events.name: closed
events.description: Emitted when the window is closed. After you have received this event you should remove the reference to the window and avoid using it anymore.

events.name: unresponsive
events.description: Emitted when the web page becomes unresponsive.

events.name: responsive
events.description: Emitted when the unresponsive web page becomes responsive again.

events.name: blur
events.description: Emitted when the window loses focus.

events.name: focus
events.description: Emitted when the window gains focus.

events.name: show
events.description: Emitted when the window is shown.

events.name: hide
events.description: Emitted when the window is hidden.

events.name: ready-to-show
events.description: Emitted when the web page has been rendered and window can be displayed without visual flash.

events.name: maximize
events.description: Emitted when window is maximized.

events.name: unmaximize
events.description: Emitted when the window exits from maximized state.

events.name: minimize
events.description: Emitted when the window is minimized.

events.name: restore
events.description: Emitted when the window is restored from minimized state.

events.name: resize
events.description: Emitted when the window is getting resized.

events.name: move
events.description: Emitted when the window is getting moved to a new position. Note: On OS X this event is just an alias of moved.

events.name: moved
events.description: Emitted once when the window is moved to a new position.

events.name: enter-full-screen
events.description: Emitted when the window enters full screen state.

events.name: leave-full-screen
events.description: Emitted when the window leaves full screen state.

events.name: enter-html-full-screen
events.description: Emitted when the window enters full screen state triggered by html api.

events.name: leave-html-full-screen
events.description: Emitted when the window leaves full screen state triggered by html api.

events.name: app-command
events.description: Emitted when an App Command is invoked. These are typically related to keyboard media keys or browser commands, as well as the "Back" button built into some mice on Windows. Commands are lowercased with underscores replaced with hyphens and the APPCOMMAND_ prefix stripped off. e.g. APPCOMMAND_BROWSER_BACKWARD is emitted as browser-backward.

events.name: scroll-touch-begin
events.description: Emitted when scroll wheel event phase has begun.

events.name: scroll-touch-end
events.description: Emitted when scroll wheel event phase has ended.

events.name: swipe
events.description: Emitted on 3-finger swipe. Possible directions are up, right, down, left.

name: contentTracing
description:
Collect tracing data from Chromium's content module for finding performance
bottlenecks and slow operations.

name: dialog
description: Display native system dialogs for opening and saving files, alerting, etc.

name: ipcMain
description: Communicate asynchronously from the main process to renderer processes.

name: globalShortcut
description: Detect keyboard events when the application does not have keyboard focus.

name: Menu
description: Create native application menus and context menus.

instanceMethods.name: popup
instanceMethods.description: Pops up this menu as a context menu in the browserWindow. You can optionally provide a x, y coordinate to place the menu at, otherwise it will be placed at the current mouse cursor position.

instanceMethods.name: append
instanceMethods.description: Appends the menuItem to the menu.

instanceMethods.name: insert
instanceMethods.description: Inserts the menuItem to the pos position of the menu.

name: MenuItem
description: Add items to native application menus and context menus.

name: powerMonitor
description: Monitor power state changes.

events.name: suspend
events.description: Emitted when the system is suspending.

events.name: resume
events.description: Emitted when system is resuming.

events.name: on-ac
events.description: Emitted when the system changes to AC power.

events.name: on-battery
events.description: Emitted when system changes to battery power.

name: powerSaveBlocker
description: Block the system from entering low-power (sleep) mode.

name: protocol
description: Register a custom protocol and intercept existing protocol requests.

name: screen
description: Retrieve information about screen size, displays, cursor position, etc.

events.name: display-added
events.description: Emitted when newDisplay has been added.

events.name: display-removed
events.description: Emitted when oldDisplay has been removed.

events.name: display-metrics-changed
events.description: Emitted when one or more metrics change in a display. The changedMetrics is an array of strings that describe the changes. Possible changes are bounds, workArea, scaleFactor and rotation.

name: session
description: Manage browser sessions, cookies, cache, proxy settings, etc.

instanceMethods.name: resolveProxy
instanceMethods.description: Resolves the proxy information for url. The callback will be called with callback(proxy) when the request is performed. Sets download saving directory. By default, the download directory will be the Downloads under the respective app folder. Emulates network with the given configuration for the session. Disables any network emulation already active for the session. Resets to the original network configuration. Sets the certificate verify proc for session, the proc will be called with proc(hostname, certificate, callback) whenever a server certificate verification is requested. Calling callback(true) accepts the certificate, calling callback(false) rejects it. Calling setCertificateVerifyProc(null) will revert back to default certificate verify proc. Sets the handler which can be used to respond to permission requests for the session. Calling callback(true) will allow the permission and callback(false) will reject it. Clears the host resolver cache. Dynamically sets whether to always send credentials for HTTP NTLM or Negotiate authentication. The webRequest API set allows to intercept and modify contents of a request at various stages of its lifetime. Each API accepts an optional filter and a listener, the listener will be called with listener(details) when the API's event has happened, the details is an object that describes the request. Passing null as listener will unsubscribe from the event. The filter is an object that has an urls property, which is an Array of URL patterns that will be used to filter out the requests that do not match the URL patterns. If the filter is omitted then all requests will be matched. For certain events the listener is passed with a callback, which should be called with an response object when listener has done its work. The listener will be called with listener(details, callback) when a request is about to occur. The uploadData is an array of data objects: The callback has to be called with an response object: The listener will be called with listener(details, callback) before sending an HTTP request, once the request headers are available. This may occur after a TCP connection is made to the server, but before any http data is sent. The callback has to be called with an response object: The listener will be called with listener(details) just before a request is going to be sent to the server, modifications of previous onBeforeSendHeaders response are visible by the time this listener is fired. The listener will be called with listener(details, callback) when HTTP response headers of a request have been received. The callback has to be called with an response object: The listener will be called with listener(details) when first byte of the response body is received. For HTTP requests, this means that the status line and response headers are available. The listener will be called with listener(details) when a server initiated redirect is about to occur. The listener will be called with listener(details) when a request is completed. The listener will be called with listener(details) when an error occurs. Returns an instance of protocol module for this session.

name: systemPreferences
description: Get system preferences.

name: Tray
description: Add icons and context menus to the system's notification area.

events.name: click
events.description: Emitted when the tray icon is clicked. Note: The bounds payload is only implemented on OS X and Windows.

returns.name: bounds
returns.description: the bounds of tray icon.

events.name: right-click
events.description: Emitted when the tray icon is right clicked.

returns.name: bounds
returns.description: the bounds of tray icon.

events.name: double-click
events.description: Emitted when the tray icon is double clicked.

returns.name: bounds
returns.description: the bounds of tray icon

events.name: balloon-show
events.description: Emitted when the tray balloon shows.

events.name: balloon-click
events.description: Emitted when the tray balloon is clicked.

events.name: balloon-closed
events.description: Emitted when the tray balloon is closed because of timeout or user manually closes it.

events.name: drop
events.description: Emitted when any dragged items are dropped on the tray icon.

events.name: drop-files
events.description: Emitted when dragged files are dropped in the tray icon.

returns.name: files
returns.description: the file path of dropped files.

events.name: drag-enter
events.description: Emitted when a drag operation enters the tray icon.

events.name: drag-leave
events.description: Emitted when a drag operation exits the tray icon.

events.name: drag-end
events.description: Emitted when a drag operation ends on the tray or ends at another location.

name: webContents
description: Render and control web pages.

instanceMethods.name: loadURL
instanceMethods.description: Loads the url in the window, the url must contain the protocol prefix, e.g. the http:// or file://. If the load should bypass http cache then use the pragma header to achieve it.

instanceMethods.name: downloadURL
instanceMethods.description: Initiates a download of the resource at url without navigating. The will-download event of session will be triggered.

instanceMethods.name: getURL
instanceMethods.description: Returns URL of the current web page.

instanceMethods.name: getTitle
instanceMethods.description: Returns the title of the current web page.

instanceMethods.name: isLoading
instanceMethods.description: Returns whether web page is still loading resources.

instanceMethods.name: isLoadingMainFrame
instanceMethods.description: Returns whether the main frame (and not just iframes or frames within it) is still loading.

instanceMethods.name: isWaitingForResponse
instanceMethods.description: Returns whether the web page is waiting for a first-response from the main resource of the page.

instanceMethods.name: stop
instanceMethods.description: Stops any pending navigation.

instanceMethods.name: reload
instanceMethods.description: Reloads the current web page.

instanceMethods.name: reloadIgnoringCache
instanceMethods.description: Reloads current page and ignores cache.

instanceMethods.name: canGoBack
instanceMethods.description: Returns whether the browser can go back to previous web page.

instanceMethods.name: canGoForward
instanceMethods.description: Returns whether the browser can go forward to next web page.

instanceMethods.name: canGoToOffset
instanceMethods.description: Returns whether the web page can go to offset.

instanceMethods.name: clearHistory
instanceMethods.description: Clears the navigation history.

instanceMethods.name: goBack
instanceMethods.description: Makes the browser go back a web page.

instanceMethods.name: goForward
instanceMethods.description: Makes the browser go forward a web page.

instanceMethods.name: goToIndex
instanceMethods.description: Navigates browser to the specified absolute web page index.

instanceMethods.name: goToOffset
instanceMethods.description: Navigates to the specified offset from the "current entry".

instanceMethods.name: isCrashed
instanceMethods.description: Whether the renderer process has crashed.

instanceMethods.name: setUserAgent
instanceMethods.description: Overrides the user agent for this web page.

instanceMethods.name: getUserAgent
instanceMethods.description: Returns a String representing the user agent for this web page.

instanceMethods.name: insertCSS
instanceMethods.description: Injects CSS into the current web page.

instanceMethods.name: executeJavaScript
instanceMethods.description: Evaluates code in page. In the browser window some HTML APIs like requestFullScreen can only be invoked by a gesture from the user. Setting userGesture to true will remove this limitation.

instanceMethods.name: setAudioMuted
instanceMethods.description: Mute the audio on the current web page.

instanceMethods.name: isAudioMuted
instanceMethods.description: Returns whether this page has been muted.

instanceMethods.name: undo
instanceMethods.description: Executes the editing command undo in web page.

instanceMethods.name: redo
instanceMethods.description: Executes the editing command redo in web page.

instanceMethods.name: cut
instanceMethods.description: Executes the editing command cut in web page.

instanceMethods.name: copy
instanceMethods.description: Executes the editing command copy in web page.

instanceMethods.name: paste
instanceMethods.description: Executes the editing command paste in web page.

instanceMethods.name: pasteAndMatchStyle
instanceMethods.description: Executes the editing command pasteAndMatchStyle in web page.

instanceMethods.name: delete
instanceMethods.description: Executes the editing command delete in web page.

instanceMethods.name: selectAll
instanceMethods.description: Executes the editing command selectAll in web page.

instanceMethods.name: unselect
instanceMethods.description: Executes the editing command unselect in web page.

instanceMethods.name: replace
instanceMethods.description: Executes the editing command replace in web page.

instanceMethods.name: replaceMisspelling
instanceMethods.description: Executes the editing command replaceMisspelling in web page.

instanceMethods.name: insertText
instanceMethods.description: Inserts text to the focused element.

instanceMethods.name: findInPage
instanceMethods.description: Starts a request to find all matches for the text in the web page and returns an Integer representing the request id used for the request. The result of the request can be obtained by subscribing to found-in-page event.

instanceMethods.name: stopFindInPage
instanceMethods.description: Stops any findInPage request for the webContents with the provided action.

instanceMethods.name: hasServiceWorker
instanceMethods.description: Checks if any ServiceWorker is registered and returns a boolean as response to callback.

instanceMethods.name: unregisterServiceWorker
instanceMethods.description: Unregisters any ServiceWorker if present and returns a boolean as response to callback when the JS promise is fulfilled or false when the JS promise is rejected.

instanceMethods.name: print
instanceMethods.description: Prints window's web page. When silent is set to false, Electron will pick up system's default printer and default settings for printing. Calling window.print() in web page is equivalent to calling webContents.print({silent: false, printBackground: false}). Note: On Windows, the print API relies on pdf.dll. If your application doesn't need the print feature, you can safely remove pdf.dll to reduce binary size.

instanceMethods.name: printToPDF
instanceMethods.description: Prints window's web page as PDF with Chromium's preview printing custom settings. The callback will be called with callback(error, data) on completion. The data is a Buffer that contains the generated PDF data. By default, an empty options will be regarded as: An example of webContents.printToPDF:

instanceMethods.name: addWorkSpace
instanceMethods.description: Adds the specified path to DevTools workspace. Must be used after DevTools creation:

instanceMethods.name: removeWorkSpace
instanceMethods.description: Removes the specified path from DevTools workspace.

instanceMethods.name: openDevTools
instanceMethods.description: Opens the devtools.

instanceMethods.name: closeDevTools
instanceMethods.description: Closes the devtools.

instanceMethods.name: isDevToolsOpened
instanceMethods.description: Returns whether the devtools is opened.

instanceMethods.name: isDevToolsFocused
instanceMethods.description: Returns whether the devtools view is focused .

instanceMethods.name: toggleDevTools
instanceMethods.description: Toggles the developer tools.

instanceMethods.name: inspectElement
instanceMethods.description: Starts inspecting element at position (x, y).

instanceMethods.name: inspectServiceWorker
instanceMethods.description: Opens the developer tools for the service worker context.

instanceMethods.name: send
instanceMethods.description: Send an asynchronous message to renderer process via channel, you can also send arbitrary arguments. Arguments will be serialized in JSON internally and hence no functions or prototype chain will be included. The renderer process can handle the message by listening to channel with the ipcRenderer module. An example of sending messages from the main process to the renderer process:

instanceMethods.name: enableDeviceEmulation
instanceMethods.description: parameters Object, properties: Enable device emulation with the given parameters.

instanceMethods.name: disableDeviceEmulation
instanceMethods.description: Disable device emulation enabled by webContents.enableDeviceEmulation.

instanceMethods.name: sendInputEvent
instanceMethods.description: Sends an input event to the page. For keyboard events, the event object also have following properties: For mouse events, the event object also have following properties: For the mouseWheel event, the event object also have following properties:

instanceMethods.name: beginFrameSubscription
instanceMethods.description: Begin subscribing for presentation events and captured frames, the callback will be called with callback(frameBuffer) when there is a presentation event. The frameBuffer is a Buffer that contains raw pixel data. On most machines, the pixel data is effectively stored in 32bit BGRA format, but the actual representation depends on the endianness of the processor (most modern processors are little-endian, on machines with big-endian processors the data is in 32bit ARGB format).

instanceMethods.name: endFrameSubscription
instanceMethods.description: End subscribing for frame presentation events.

instanceMethods.name: savePage
instanceMethods.description: Returns true if the process of saving page has been initiated successfully.

instanceMethods.name: showDefinitionForSelection
instanceMethods.description: Shows pop-up dictionary that searches the selected word on the page.

events.name: did-finish-load
events.description: Emitted when the navigation is done, i.e. the spinner of the tab has stopped spinning, and the onload event was dispatched.

events.name: did-fail-load
events.description: This event is like did-finish-load but emitted when the load failed or was cancelled, e.g. window.stop() is invoked. The full list of error codes and their meaning is available here. Note that redirect responses will emit errorCode -3; you may want to ignore that error explicitly.

events.name: did-frame-finish-load
events.description: Emitted when a frame has done navigation.

events.name: did-start-loading
events.description: Corresponds to the points in time when the spinner of the tab started spinning.

events.name: did-stop-loading
events.description: Corresponds to the points in time when the spinner of the tab stopped spinning.

events.name: did-get-response-details
events.description: Emitted when details regarding a requested resource are available. status indicates the socket connection to download the resource.

events.name: did-get-redirect-request
events.description: Emitted when a redirect is received while requesting a resource.

events.name: dom-ready
events.description: Emitted when the document in the given frame is loaded.

events.name: page-favicon-updated
events.description: Emitted when page receives favicon urls.

returns.name: favicons
returns.description: Array of URLs

events.name: new-window
events.description: Emitted when the page requests to open a new window for a url. It could be requested by window.open or an external link like <a target='_blank'>. By default a new BrowserWindow will be created for the url. Calling event.preventDefault() will prevent creating new windows.

returns.name: disposition
returns.description: Can be default, foreground-tab, background-tab,

returns.name: options
returns.description: The options which will be used for creating the new

events.name: will-navigate
events.description: Emitted when a user or the page wants to start navigation. It can happen when the window.location object is changed or a user clicks a link in the page. This event will not emit when the navigation is started programmatically with APIs like webContents.loadURL and webContents.back. It is also not emitted for in-page navigations, such as clicking anchor links or updating the window.location.hash. Use did-navigate-in-page event for this purpose. Calling event.preventDefault() will prevent the navigation.

events.name: did-navigate
events.description: Emitted when a navigation is done. This event is not emitted for in-page navigations, such as clicking anchor links or updating the window.location.hash. Use did-navigate-in-page event for this purpose.

events.name: did-navigate-in-page
events.description: Emitted when an in-page navigation happened. When in-page navigation happens, the page URL changes but does not cause navigation outside of the page. Examples of this occurring are when anchor links are clicked or when the DOM hashchange event is triggered.

events.name: crashed
events.description: Emitted when the renderer process has crashed.

events.name: plugin-crashed
events.description: Emitted when a plugin process has crashed.

events.name: destroyed
events.description: Emitted when webContents is destroyed.

events.name: devtools-opened
events.description: Emitted when DevTools is opened.

events.name: devtools-closed
events.description: Emitted when DevTools is closed.

events.name: devtools-focused
events.description: Emitted when DevTools is focused / opened.

events.name: certificate-error
events.description: Emitted when failed to verify the certificate for url. The usage is the same with the certificate-error event of app.

returns.name: error
returns.description: The error code

events.name: select-client-certificate
events.description: Emitted when a client certificate is requested. The usage is the same with the select-client-certificate event of app.

events.name: login
events.description: Emitted when webContents wants to do basic auth. The usage is the same with the login event of app.

events.name: found-in-page
events.description: Emitted when a result is available for webContents.findInPage request.

properties.name: finalUpdate
properties.type: Boolean - Indicates if more responses are to follow.

properties.name: activeMatchOrdinal
properties.type: Integer (optional) - Position of the active match.

properties.name: selectionArea
properties.type: Object (optional) - Coordinates of first match region.

events.name: media-started-playing
events.description: Emitted when media starts playing.

events.name: media-paused
events.description: Emitted when media is paused or done playing.

events.name: did-change-theme-color
events.description: Emitted when a page's theme color changes. This is usually due to encountering a meta tag:

events.name: update-target-url
events.description: Emitted when mouse moves over a link or the keyboard moves the focus to a link.

events.name: cursor-changed
events.description: Emitted when the cursor's type changes. The type parameter can be default, crosshair, pointer, text, wait, help, e-resize, n-resize, ne-resize, nw-resize, s-resize, se-resize, sw-resize, w-resize, ns-resize, ew-resize, nesw-resize, nwse-resize, col-resize, row-resize, m-panning, e-panning, n-panning, ne-panning, nw-panning, s-panning, se-panning, sw-panning, w-panning, move, vertical-text, cell, context-menu, alias, progress, nodrop, copy, none, not-allowed, zoom-in, zoom-out, grab, grabbing, custom. If the type parameter is custom, the image parameter will hold the custom cursor image in a NativeImage, and the scale will hold scaling information for the image.

events.name: context-menu
events.description: The mediaFlags is an object with the following properties: The editFlags is an object with the following properties: Emitted when there is a new context menu that needs to be handled.

properties.name: linkURL
properties.type: String - URL of the link that encloses the node the context menu

properties.name: linkText
properties.type: String - Text associated with the link. May be an empty

properties.name: pageURL
properties.type: String - URL of the top level page that the context menu was

properties.name: frameURL
properties.type: String - URL of the subframe that the context menu was invoked

properties.name: srcURL
properties.type: String - Source URL for the element that the context menu

properties.name: mediaType
properties.type: String - Type of the node the context menu was invoked on. Can

properties.name: hasImageContent
properties.type: Boolean - Wether the context menu was invoked on an image

properties.name: isEditable
properties.type: Boolean - Wether the context is editable.

properties.name: selectionText
properties.type: String - Text of the selection that the context menu was

properties.name: titleText
properties.type: String - Title or alt text of the selection that the context

properties.name: misspelledWord
properties.type: String - The misspelled word under the cursor, if any.

properties.name: frameCharset
properties.type: String - The character encoding of the frame on which the

properties.name: inputFieldType
properties.type: String - If the context menu was invoked on an input

properties.name: menuSourceType
properties.type: String - Input source that invoked the context menu.

properties.name: mediaFlags
properties.type: Object - The flags for the media element the context menu was

properties.name: editFlags
properties.type: Object - These flags indicate wether the renderer believes it is

returns.name: inError
returns.description: Wether the media element has crashed.

returns.name: isPaused
returns.description: Wether the media element is paused.

returns.name: isMuted
returns.description: Wether the media element is muted.

returns.name: hasAudio
returns.description: Wether the media element has audio.

returns.name: isLooping
returns.description: Wether the media element is looping.

returns.name: isControlsVisible
returns.description: Wether the media element's controls are

returns.name: canToggleControls
returns.description: Wether the media element's controls are

returns.name: canRotate
returns.description: Wether the media element can be rotated.

returns.name: canUndo
returns.description: Wether the renderer believes it can undo.

returns.name: canRedo
returns.description: Wether the renderer believes it can redo.

returns.name: canCut
returns.description: Wether the renderer believes it can cut.

returns.name: canCopy
returns.description: Wether the renderer believes it can copy

returns.name: canPaste
returns.description: Wether the renderer believes it can paste.

returns.name: canDelete
returns.description: Wether the renderer believes it can delete.

returns.name: canSelectAll
returns.description: Wether the renderer believes it can select all.

events.name: select-bluetooth-device
events.description: Emitted when bluetooth device needs to be selected on call to navigator.bluetooth.requestDevice. To use navigator.bluetooth api webBluetooth should be enabled.  If event.preventDefault is not called, first available device will be selected. callback should be called with deviceId to be selected, passing empty string to callback will cancel the request.

name: process
description: Extensions to process object.

events.name: loaded
events.description: Emitted when Electron has loaded its internal initialization script and is beginning to load the web page or the main script. It can be used by the preload script to add removed Node global symbols back to the global scope when node integration is turned off:

name: desktopCapturer
description:
List getUserMedia sources for capturing audio, video, and images from a
microphone, camera, or screen.

name: ipcRenderer
description: Communicate asynchronously from a renderer process to the main process.

name: remote
description: Use main process modules from the renderer process.

name: webFrame
description: Customize the rendering of the current web page.
